words.hint: The dark wizard from the magic school books who must not be named
A symbol showing a head bone over two others, used for poison or pirates
The man who tried to blow up the British parliament in 1605
The unidentified Victorian serial killer who haunted London
The villain with metal claws who hunts teenagers in their sleep
The mythical woman with snakes for hair whose gaze turns men to rock
The boy who flew too close to the sun with wax wings and fell
A legend about a blade hanging by a single hair over a king's head
A far-right governmental system with total control by a dictator
A style of cinema featuring cynical heroes and dark, rainy city streets
The severe global economic collapse that started in 1929
A term used for a place where movement is heavily restricted and monitored
Indirectly showing anger instead of being open about it
The arch-enemy of the Batman, known for his chaotic laugh
An imagined place or state of things in which everything is perfect
The knight who famously fought windmills thinking they were giants
A classic poem describing a journey through the circles of hell
The legendary 90s crime movie known for its non-linear story
A proverb suggesting that common foes make for natural allies
The cultured doctor who famously tells Clarice about eating liver
The dark lord who wears a black mask and breathing suit in space
A dark period in 1690s America where many were accused of magic
An area in the ocean where planes and ships supposedly vanish
The spirit you supposedly summon by saying her name in a mirror
A gift that hides a secret group of invaders inside it
The all-seeing figure of authority from the novel Nineteen Eighty-Four
The decades-long tension between the USA and the Soviet Union
The hidden part of the internet often used for shady activities
A horror game and movie about a town permanentely covered in fog
A legendary creature said to live in a deep lake in Scotland
The mysterious mystic who advised the last Russian Tsar family
Someone whose job is to cast out spirits from a possessed person
The building or room where bodies are kept before burial
A dangerous spider or a woman who kills her partners
A movie series where survivors can't escape their scheduled end
